quote.text: Jesus went unto the mount of Olives.
quote.author: John

quote.text: And early in the morning he came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him; and he sat down, and taught them.
quote.author: John

quote.text: And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery; and when they had set her in the midst,
quote.author: John

quote.text: They say unto him, Master, this woman was taken in adultery, in the very act.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Now Moses in the law commanded us, that such should be stoned: but what sayest thou?
quote.author: John

quote.text: This they said, tempting him, that they might have to accuse him. But Jesus stooped down, and with his finger wrote on the ground, as though he heard them not.
quote.author: John

quote.text: So when they continued asking him, he lifted up himself, and said unto them, He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her.
quote.author: John

quote.text: And again he stooped down, and wrote on the ground.
quote.author: John

quote.text: And they which heard it, being convicted by their own conscience, went out one by one, beginning at the eldest, even unto the last: and Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.
quote.author: John

quote.text: When Jesus had lifted up himself, and saw none but the woman, he said unto her, Woman, where are those thine accusers? hath no man condemned thee?
quote.author: John

quote.text: She said, No man, Lord. And Jesus said unto her, Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Then spake Jesus again unto them, saying, I am the light of the world: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.
quote.author: John

quote.text: The Pharisees therefore said unto him, Thou bearest record of thyself; thy record is not true.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Though I bear record of myself, yet my record is true: for I know whence I came, and whither I go; but ye cannot tell whence I come, and whither I go.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Ye judge after the flesh; I judge no man.
quote.author: John

quote.text: And yet if I judge, my judgment is true: for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.
quote.author: John

quote.text: It is also written in your law, that the testimony of two men is true.
quote.author: John

quote.text: I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Then said they unto him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered, Ye neither know me, nor my Father: if ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also.
quote.author: John

quote.text: These words spake Jesus in the treasury, as he taught in the temple: and no man laid hands on him; for his hour was not yet come.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Then said Jesus again unto them, I go my way, and ye shall seek me, and shall die in your sins: whither I go, ye cannot come.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Then said the Jews, Will he kill himself? because he saith, Whither I go, ye cannot come.
quote.author: John

quote.text: And he said unto them, Ye are from beneath; I am from above: ye are of this world; I am not of this world.
quote.author: John

quote.text: I said therefore unto you, that ye shall die in your sins: for if ye believe not that I am he, ye shall die in your sins.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Then said they unto him, Who art thou? And Jesus saith unto them, Even the same that I said unto you from the beginning.
quote.author: John

quote.text: I have many things to say and to judge of you: but he that sent me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him.
quote.author: John

quote.text: They understood not that he spake to them of the Father.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Then said Jesus unto them, When ye have lifted up the Son of man, then shall ye know that I am he, and that I do nothing of myself; but as my Father hath taught me, I speak these things.
quote.author: John

quote.text: And he that sent me is with me: the Father hath not left me alone; for I do always those things that please him.
quote.author: John

quote.text: As he spake these words, many believed on him.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him, If ye continue in my word, then are ye my disciples indeed;
quote.author: John

quote.text: And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.
quote.author: John

quote.text: They answered him, We be Abraham's seed, and were never in bondage to any man: how sayest thou, Ye shall be made free?
quote.author: John

quote.text: Jesus answered them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.
quote.author: John

quote.text: And the servant abideth not in the house for ever: but the Son abideth ever.
quote.author: John

quote.text: If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.
quote.author: John

quote.text: I know that ye are Abraham's seed; but ye seek to kill me, because my word hath no place in you.
quote.author: John

quote.text: I speak that which I have seen with my Father: and ye do that which ye have seen with your father.
quote.author: John

quote.text: They answered and said unto him, Abraham is our father. Jesus saith unto them, If ye were Abraham's children, ye would do the works of Abraham.
quote.author: John

quote.text: But now ye seek to kill me, a man that hath told you the truth, which I have heard of God: this did not Abraham.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Ye do the deeds of your father. Then said they to him, We be not born of fornication; we have one Father, even God.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Jesus said unto them, If God were your Father, ye would love me: for I proceeded forth and came from God; neither came I of myself, but he sent me.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Why do ye not understand my speech? even because ye cannot hear my word.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Ye are of your father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father of it.
quote.author: John

quote.text: And because I tell you the truth, ye believe me not.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Which of you convinceth me of sin? And if I say the truth, why do ye not believe me?
quote.author: John

quote.text: He that is of God heareth God's words: ye therefore hear them not, because ye are not of God.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Then answered the Jews, and said unto him, Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a devil?
quote.author: John

quote.text: Jesus answered, I have not a devil; but I honour my Father, and ye do dishonour me.
quote.author: John

quote.text: And I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Then said the Jews unto him, Now we know that thou hast a devil. Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest, If a man keep my saying, he shall never taste of death.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Art thou greater than our father Abraham, which is dead? and the prophets are dead: whom makest thou thyself?
quote.author: John

quote.text: Jesus answered, If I honour myself, my honour is nothing: it is my Father that honoureth me; of whom ye say, that he is your God:
quote.author: John

quote.text: Yet ye have not known him; but I know him: and if I should say, I know him not, I shall be a liar like unto you: but I know him, and keep his saying.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day: and he saw it, and was glad.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Then said the Jews unto him, Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?
quote.author: John

quote.text: Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.
quote.author: John

quote.text: Then took they up stones to cast at him: but Jesus hid himself, and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.
quote.author: John
